ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The course is simultaneously very enjoyable and difficult. There is a whole lot of material, but you will learn a huge amount.
Great intro course to major environmental laws and policies. Definitely worthwhile for non-law students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was very different from most of my graduate school studies, which have been science-based and fairly directed to my research. However, I learned many things about how science is applied by lawmakers and others working in the "real world." This information is very useful to know, though most scientists tend not to think about it.
Definitely saw some overlaps with my discipline and public policy development in other sectors (health, international relations, human rights). Appropriate class given recent talks on climate change.
